revised_title: Analysis of Microscopic Organisms Swimming Mechanisms
tldr: The author investigates the swimming mechanisms of microscopic organisms, particularly focusing on the propulsion of spermatozoa. They analyze the motion of a fluid near a sheet with waves of lateral displacement and find that the sheet moves forward at a rate times the velocity of the wave propagation. This analysis explains how a propulsive tail can move a body through a viscous fluid without relying on reaction due to inertia. The energy dissipation and stress in the tail are also calculated.
